alert.note: Alert for Brown (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 5:53PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Brown County through 645 PM CDT... At 553 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northeast of Hiawatha, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hiawatha, Robinson and Reserve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
